issue.title: How can i export all records using yajra datatables?
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request


I need to export all records on click in csv button but now yajra only export record of current page. Someone can help me? @yajra 

### Code snippet of problem

```
return $this->builder()
                    ->setTableId('drcsendmoneytransac-table')
                    ->columns($this->getColumns())
                    ->minifiedAjax()
                    ->stateSave(true)
                    // ->responsive()
                    ->autoWidth(false)
                    ->parameters(['scrollX' => true])
                    ->addTableClass('align-middle table-row-dashed fs-6 gy-5')
                    ->parameters([  
                        'dom'          => 'Bfrtip',  
                        'buttons'      => ['excel', 'csv', 'pdf'],  
                    ])
                    ->orderBy(0)
                    ->selectStyleSingle();
```

### System details


- Windows
- PHP 8
- Laravel 9
- Laravel-Datatables 9

comment.body:
You need to use the server-side export buttons https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/buttons-starter.

You need to load the custom scripts `<script src="/vendor/datatables/buttons.server-side.js"></script>`

issue.title: case_insensitive search does not search for upper case keywords
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899
Originally posted by **uchajk** November 12, 2022 `Case insensitive will search the keyword in lower case format. SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #2916 from uchajk/master

fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917

pull_request.title: fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917
pull_request.body:
```
'search'         => [
        'smart'            => false,
        'multi_term'       => false,
        'case_insensitive' => true,
        'use_wildcards'    => false,
        'starts_with'      => true,
    ],
```
If this is the case, line 449 would return keyword% without converting it to lower case first. The change suggested in this request will first check the sensitivity, convert to lower if set to true, and then return lower("$keyword%").

issue.title: case_insensitive search does not search for upper case keywords
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899
Originally posted by **uchajk** November 12, 2022 `Case insensitive will search the keyword in lower case format. SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:
A workaround to disable search on the specific columns is via [filterColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/filter-column#main-content) and add an empty closure.

```php
    return DataTables::eloquent($model)
                ->filterColumn('fullname', function($query, $keyword) {})
```

The same goes with [orderColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/order-column#main-content).

Lastly, you can do your own [manual search](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/manual-search#main-content) and disable global search.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:
You can use the following if that is a concern for your use case:

https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/whitelist
https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/blacklist

> yajra/laravel-datatables

Is the all-in-one installer I created which will install other packages like buttons, HTML, editor, etc.

> yajra/laravel-datatables-oracle

This is the core library of datatables for Laravel.

issue.title: how to apply a WHERE query on the HTML Builder Plugin?
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

How can I apply a WHERE query on the HTML Builder Plugin with a {id} which comes from the web.php router,


### Code snippet of problem

web.php

```
Route::get('/servers/filter/location/{id}', [App\Http\Controllers\Hardware\ServersController::class, 'filterLocation'])->name('Servers');
```

ServersController

```
public function filterLocation(ServersDataTable $dataTable, Request $request) {
        $rackspace = Server::where('rackspace_id', '=', $request->location)->get();
        return $dataTable->render('hardware.servers', compact('rackspace'), $request->id);
    }
```

Where/how can I apply this `$request->id` in ServersDataTable.php to filter the table? :)

I tried this, but no luck :(

```
/**
     * Get query source of dataTable.
     *
     * @param \App\Models\Server $model
     * @return \Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Builder
     */
    public function query(Server $model, Request $request): QueryBuilder {
        return $model->newQuery()->where('rackspace_id', '=', $request->id)->with(['rackspace', 'customer', 'disk']);
    }
```

### System details

- Operating System: ubuntu 22.04
- PHP Version: 8.1
- Laravel Version 9.41.0
- Laravel-Datatables 9.0

issue.title: Fixes some issues and confusion of datatable generator command
issue.body:
This pull request fixes plethora of issues for the `datatables:make` command -
1. Fixes `datatables:make` command fail to generate error free classes for the following scenarios where it can't identify the model name and namespace correctly -
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driverdatatable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver --model-namespace=App\\Custom`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --builder`
2. Fixes appending `DataTable` with mix-case or lowercase generating different class name.
4. In `datatables:make` command, the `getModel()` method was too confusing. Tried to simplify the logic and removed code duplication. Such as, there's no need to check for -
    - Existence of `Models` directory and 
    - Root namespace when model namespace is provided by the user (either in config or in arguments).
6. Fixes where  `datatables:make --builder` command will always fail to create HTML builder class.

comment.body: Released on v9.1.3, thanks a lot! 🚀

issue.title: Allow for a large number of column names in compound indicies
issue.body:
When creating a compound/composite index with 6 columns we noticed that the while loop to create the index name was never ending, causing the php artisan migrate command to hang.

By providing for recognition of large numbers of columns in compound indicies we can avoid the while loop completely and return out of the function whilst writing a sane and unique index name.

comment.body: Released on v9.0.4, thanks! 🚀

issue.title: Compatibility with DataTables 1.13's ES modules
issue.body:
Now that DataTables provides ES modules, Vite will automatically use them rather than the UMD files. However, the signature of the ESM files is slightly different from the CommonJS loader that was used before. We no longer need to execute a function - it is just present automatically from the import.

I've also shortened the setting of how the default properties are set. It does exactly the same thing.

comment.body:
Hi @AllanJard,

Thanks for the patch, appreciate it! Learned something new here. 

Tested on [Quick Starter](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/quick-starter) and all working well now.

Released on v0.5.0 🚀 

Regards!

issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request


I need to export all records on click in csv button but now yajra only export record of current page. Someone can help me? @yajra 

### Code snippet of problem

```
return $this->builder()
                    ->setTableId('drcsendmoneytransac-table')
                    ->columns($this->getColumns())
                    ->minifiedAjax()
                    ->stateSave(true)
                    // ->responsive()
                    ->autoWidth(false)
                    ->parameters(['scrollX' => true])
                    ->addTableClass('align-middle table-row-dashed fs-6 gy-5')
                    ->parameters([  
                        'dom'          => 'Bfrtip',  
                        'buttons'      => ['excel', 'csv', 'pdf'],

                    ->selectStyleSingle();
```

### System details


- Windows
- PHP 8
- Laravel 9
- Laravel-Datatables 9

comment.body:
You need to use the server-side export buttons https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/buttons-starter.

You need to load the custom scripts `<script src="/vendor/datatables/buttons.server-side.js"></script>`

issue.title: case_insensitive search does not search for upper case keywords
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899
Originally posted by **uchajk** November 12, 2022 `Case insensitive will search the keyword in lower case format. SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #2916 from uchajk/master

fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917

pull_request.title: fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917
pull_request.body:
```
'search'         => [
        'smart'            => false,
        'multi_term'       => false,
        'case_insensitive' => true,
        'use_wildcards'    => false,
        'starts_with'      => true,
    ],
```
If this is the case, line 449 would return keyword% without converting it to lower case first. The change suggested in this request will first check the sensitivity, convert to lower if set to true, and then return lower("$keyword%").

issue.title: case_insensitive search does not search for upper case keywords
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899
Originally posted by **uchajk** November 12, 2022 `Case insensitive will search the keyword in lower case format. SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:
A workaround to disable search on the specific columns is via [filterColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/filter-column#main-content) and add an empty closure.

```php
    return DataTables::eloquent($model)
                ->filterColumn('fullname', function($query, $keyword) {})
```

The same goes with [orderColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/order-column#main-content).

Lastly, you can do your own [manual search](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/manual-search#main-content) and disable global search.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:
You can use the following if that is a concern for your use case:

https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/whitelist
https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/blacklist

issue.title: how to apply a WHERE query on the HTML Builder Plugin?
issue.body:
### Summary of problem or feature request

How can I apply a WHERE query on the HTML Builder Plugin with a {id} which comes from the web.php router,


### Code snippet of problem

web.php

```
Route::get('/servers/filter/location/{id}', [App\Http\Controllers\Hardware\ServersController::class, 'filterLocation'])->name('Servers');
```

ServersController

```
public function filterLocation(ServersDataTable $dataTable, Request $request) {
        $rackspace = Server::where('rackspace_id', '=', $request->location)->get();
        return $dataTable->render('hardware.servers', compact('rackspace'), $request->id);
    }
```

Where/how can I apply this `$request->id` in ServersDataTable.php to filter the table? :)

I tried this, but no luck :(

```
/**
     * Get query source of dataTable.
     *
     * @param \App\Models\Server $model
     * @return \Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Builder
     */
    public function query(Server $model, Request $request): QueryBuilder {
        return $model->newQuery()->where('rackspace_id', '=', $request->id)->with(['rackspace', 'customer', 'disk']);
    }
```

### System details

- Operating System: ubuntu 22.04
- PHP Version: 8.1
- Laravel Version 9.41.0
- Laravel-Datatables 9.0

issue.title: Fixes some issues and confusion of datatable generator command
issue.body:
This pull request fixes plethora of issues for the `datatables:make` command -
1. Fixes `datatables:make` command fail to generate error free classes for the following scenarios where it can't identify the model name and namespace correctly -
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driverdatatable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver --model-namespace=App\\Custom`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --builder`
2. Fixes appending `DataTable` with mix-case or lowercase generating different class name.
4. In `datatables:make` command, the `getModel()` method was too confusing. Tried to simplify the logic and removed code duplication. Such as, there's no need to check for -
    - Existence of `Models` directory and 
    - Root namespace when model namespace is provided by the user (either in config or in arguments).
6. Fixes where  `datatables:make --builder` command will always fail to create HTML builder class.

comment.body: Released on v9.1.3, thanks a lot! 🚀

issue.title: Allow for a large number of column names in compound indicies
issue.body:
When creating a compound/composite index with 6 columns we noticed that the while loop to create the index name was never ending, causing the php artisan migrate command to hang.

By providing for recognition of large numbers of columns in compound indicies we can avoid the while loop completely and return out of the function whilst writing a sane and unique index name.

comment.body: Released on v9.0.4, thanks! 🚀

commits.message:
Allow for a large number of column names in compound indicies

When creating a compound/composite index with 6 columns we noticed that the while loop to create the index name was never ending, causing the php artisan migrate command to hang.

By providing for recognition of large numbers of column in compound indexes we can avoid the while loop completely by writing a sane and unique index name.

Merge pull request #735 from ryanlovett-au/9.x

pull_request.title: Allow for a large number of column names in compound indicies
pull_request.body:
When creating a compound/composite index with 6 columns we noticed that the while loop to create the index name was never ending, causing the php artisan migrate command to hang.

By providing for recognition of large numbers of columns in compound indicies we can avoid the while loop completely and return out of the function whilst writing a sane and unique index name.

issue.title: Compatibility with DataTables 1.13's ES modules
issue.body:
Now that DataTables provides ES modules, Vite will automatically use them rather than the UMD files. However, the signature of the ESM files is slightly different from the CommonJS loader that was used before. We no longer need to execute a function - it is just present automatically from the import.

I've also shortened the setting of how the default properties are set. It does exactly the same thing.

issue.title: case_insensitive search does not search for upper case keywords
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899
Originally posted by **uchajk** November 12, 2022 `Case insensitive will search the keyword in lower case format. SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #2916 from uchajk/master

fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917

pull_request.title: fix: case insensitive starts with search #2917
pull_request.body:
```
'search'         => [
        'smart'            => false,
        'multi_term'       => false,
        'case_insensitive' => true,
        'use_wildcards'    => false,
        'starts_with'      => true,
    ],
```
If this is the case, line 449 would return keyword% without converting it to lower case first. The change suggested in this request will first check the sensitivity, convert to lower if set to true, and then return lower("$keyword%").

### Discussed in https://github.com/yajra/laravel-datatables/discussions/2899

SQL: LOWER(column) LIKE LOWER(keyword)` `'case_insensitive' => true,` I've got an issue with this part of the documentation. Particular column in my table is in upper case and so when searching in lower case: `$keyword = 'abc'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` this works just fine When searching upper case though: `$keyword = 'ABC'` `$column = LOWER('ABC')` does not match the column. LOWER(keyword) is not applied.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:
A workaround to disable search on the specific columns is via [filterColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/filter-column#main-content) and add an empty closure.

```php
    return DataTables::eloquent($model)
                ->filterColumn('fullname', function($query, $keyword) {})
```

The same goes with [orderColumn](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/order-column#main-content).

Lastly, you can do your own [manual search](https://yajrabox.com/docs/laravel-datatables/10.0/manual-search#main-content) and disable global search.

issue.title: security issue at global search function
issue.body: Is it secure when we get the searchable columns from the request at `globalSearch` via `$this->request->searchableColumnIndex()` , My end users edit the columns array at the client side to add columns that aren't exists in the original datatable columns so they could do search query on them

comment.body:

issue.title: Fixes some issues and confusion of datatable generator command
issue.body:
This pull request fixes plethora of issues for the `datatables:make` command -
1. Fixes `datatables:make` command fail to generate error free classes for the following scenarios where it can't identify the model name and namespace correctly -
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driverdatatable`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --model=Driver --model-namespace=App\\Custom`
    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --builder`
2. Fixes appending `DataTable` with mix-case or lowercase generating different class name.
4. In `datatables:make` command, the `getModel()` method was too confusing. Tried to simplify the logic and removed code duplication. Such as, there's no need to check for -
    - Existence of `Models` directory and 
    - Root namespace when model namespace is provided by the user (either in config or in arguments).
6. Fixes where  `datatables:make --builder` command will always fail to create HTML builder class.

comment.body: Released on v9.1.3, thanks a lot! 🚀

    - `php artisan datatables:make Api/DriverDataTable --builder`
2. Fixes appending `DataTable` with mix-case or lowercase generating different class name.
4. In `datatables:make` command, the `getModel()` method was too confusing. Tried to simplify the logic and removed code duplication. Such as, there's no need to check for -
    - Existence of `Models` directory and 
    - Root namespace when model namespace is provided by the user (either in config or in arguments).
6. Fixes where  `datatables:make --builder` command will always fail to create HTML builder class.

comment.body: Good day @rahulhaque, no problem with the changes. Will review this as soon as I can. Thanks!

issue.title: Allow for a large number of column names in compound indicies
issue.body:
When creating a compound/composite index with 6 columns we noticed that the while loop to create the index name was never ending, causing the php artisan migrate command to hang.

By providing for recognition of large numbers of columns in compound indicies we can avoid the while loop completely and return out of the function whilst writing a sane and unique index name.

comment.body: Released on v9.0.4, thanks! 🚀

issue.title: Compatibility with DataTables 1.13's ES modules
issue.body:
Now that DataTables provides ES modules, Vite will automatically use them rather than the UMD files. However, the signature of the ESM files is slightly different from the CommonJS loader that was used before. We no longer need to execute a function - it is just present automatically from the import.

I've also shortened the setting of how the default properties are set. It does exactly the same thing.

Released on v0.5.0 🚀 

Regards!
